The file has been successfully updated. Now the program properly handles paths that start with `~/` on Linux. Here's what the fix does:

## Key Changes Made:

1. **Home Directory Expansion**: 
 <augment_code_snippet path="SDLexemeDecoder/Program.cs" mode="EXCERPT">
 ```csharp
 // Expand ~ to home directory if present
 string expandedPattern = globPattern.StartsWith("~/") 
 ? Path.Combine(Environment.GetFolderPath(Environment.SpecialFolder.UserProfile), globPattern[2..])
 : globPattern;
 ```
 </augment_code_snippet>

2. **Path Separation**:
 <augment_code_snippet path="SDLexemeDecoder/Program.cs" mode="EXCERPT">
 ```csharp
 // Separate directory path from pattern
 string directory = Path.GetDirectoryName(expandedPattern) ?? ".";
 string pattern = Path.GetFileName(expandedPattern);
 ```
 </augment_code_snippet>

3. **Proper Directory Usage**:
 <augment_code_snippet path="SDLexemeDecoder/Program.cs" mode="EXCERPT">
 ```csharp
 // Get all files matching the glob pattern
 string[] matchingFiles = Directory.GetFiles(directory, pattern, SearchOption.TopDirectoryOnly);
 ```
 </augment_code_snippet>

## How It Works Now:

- **`~/Documents/*.txt`** → Expands `~` to your home directory, then searches in `Documents` folder for `*.txt` files
- **`/absolute/path/*.log`** → Uses the absolute path directly
- **`*.cs`** → Uses current directory (same as before)
- **`subfolder/*.json`** → Searches in `subfolder` relative to current directory

The program now correctly handles Linux path conventions and won't try to prepend the current directory to paths that already include a directory component.
"},{"id":2,"type":2,"content":"Perfect! The file has been successfully updated. Now the program properly handles paths that start with `~/` on Linux. Here's what the fix does:

## Key Changes Made:

1. **Home Directory Expansion**: 
````csharp path=SDLexemeDecoder/Program.cs mode=EXCERPT
 // Expand ~ to home directory if present
 string expandedPattern = globPattern.StartsWith("~/") 
 ? Path.Combine(Environment.GetFolderPath(Environment.SpecialFolder.UserProfile), globPattern[2..])
 : globPattern;
````

2. **Path Separation**:
````csharp path=SDLexemeDecoder/Program.cs mode=EXCERPT
 // Separate directory path from pattern
 string directory = Path.GetDirectoryName(expandedPattern) ?? ".";
 string pattern = Path.GetFileName(expandedPattern);
````

3. **Proper Directory Usage**:
````csharp path=SDLexemeDecoder/Program.cs mode=EXCERPT
 // Get all files matching the glob pattern
 string[] matchingFiles = Directory.GetFiles(directory, pattern, SearchOption.TopDirectoryOnly);
````

## How It Works Now:

- **`~/Documents/*.txt`** → Expands `~` to your home directory, then searches in `Documents` folder for `*.txt` files
- **`/absolute/path/*.log`** → Uses the absolute path directly
- **`*.cs`** → Uses current directory (same as before)
- **`subfolder/*.json`** → Searches in `subfolder` relative to current directory

The program now correctly handles Linux path conventions and won't try to prepend the current directory to paths that already include a directory component.

 using System.IO;

// Check if a glob pattern was provided as an argument
if (args.Length == 0)
{
 Console.WriteLine("Usage: SDLexemeDecoder <glob-pattern>");
 Console.WriteLine("Example: SDLexemeDecoder \"*.txt\"");
 return 1;
}

string globPattern = args[0];

try
{
 // Expand ~ to home directory if present
 string expandedPattern = globPattern.StartsWith("~/") 
 ? Path.Combine(Environment.GetFolderPath(Environment.SpecialFolder.UserProfile), globPattern[2..])
 : globPattern;
 
 // Separate directory path from pattern
 string directory = Path.GetDirectoryName(expandedPattern) ?? ".";
 string pattern = Path.GetFileName(expandedPattern);
 
 // If the directory is empty (pattern had no directory part), use current directory
 if (string.IsNullOrEmpty(directory))
 {
 directory = ".";
 }
 
 // Get all files matching the glob pattern
 string[] matchingFiles = Directory.GetFiles(directory, pattern, SearchOption.TopDirectoryOnly);
 
 if (matchingFiles.Length == 0)
 {
 Console.WriteLine($"No files found matching pattern: {globPattern}");
 return 0;
 }
 
 // Process each matching file
 foreach (string filePath in matchingFiles)
 {
 PrintFileName(filePath);
 }
}
catch (Exception ex)
{
 Console.WriteLine($"Error processing files: {ex.Message}");
 return 1;
}

return 0;

/// <summary>
/// Prints the filename to the console
/// </summary>
/// <param name="filePath">The full path to the file</param>
static void PrintFileName(string filePath)
{
 string fileName = Path.GetFileName(filePath);
 Console.WriteLine($"Processing file: {fileName}");
}

 </stdout>
 <stderr>

 using System.IO;

// Check if a glob pattern was provided as an argument
if (args.Length == 0)
{
 Console.WriteLine("Usage: LexemeExtractor <glob-pattern>");
 Console.WriteLine("Example: LexemeExtractor \"*.txt\"");
 return 1;
}

var globPattern = args[0];

try
{
 // Expand ~ to home directory if present using pattern matching
 var expandedPattern = globPattern switch
 {
 ['~', '/', .. var rest] => Path.Combine(Environment.GetFolderPath(Environment.SpecialFolder.UserProfile), rest),
 _ => globPattern
 };
 
 // Separate directory path from pattern
 var directory = Path.GetDirectoryName(expandedPattern) switch
 {
 null or "" => ".",
 var dir => dir
 };
 var pattern = Path.GetFileName(expandedPattern);
 
 // Get all files matching the glob pattern
 var matchingFiles = Directory.GetFiles(directory, pattern, SearchOption.TopDirectoryOnly);
 
 if (matchingFiles.Length == 0)
 {
 Console.WriteLine($"No files found matching pattern: {globPattern}");
 return 0;
 }
 
 // Process each matching file using modern foreach
 foreach (var filePath in matchingFiles)
 {
 ProcessFile(filePath);
 }
}
catch (Exception ex)
{
 Console.WriteLine($"Error processing files: {ex.Message}");
 return 1;
}

return 0;

static void ProcessFile(string filePath) =>
 Console.WriteLine($"Processing file: {Path.GetFileName(filePath)}");

 using System.IO;

// Check if a glob pattern was provided as an argument
if (args.Length == 0)
{
 Console.WriteLine("Usage: SDLexemeDecoder <glob-pattern>");
 Console.WriteLine("Example: SDLexemeDecoder \"*.txt\"");
 return 1;
}

string globPattern = args[0];

try
{
 // Expand ~ to home directory if present
 string expandedPattern = globPattern.StartsWith("~/") 
 ? Path.Combine(Environment.GetFolderPath(Environment.SpecialFolder.UserProfile), globPattern[2..])
 : globPattern;
 
 // Separate directory path from pattern
 string directory = Path.GetDirectoryName(expandedPattern) ?? ".";
 string pattern = Path.GetFileName(expandedPattern);
 
 // If the directory is empty (pattern had no directory part), use current directory
 if (string.IsNullOrEmpty(directory))
 {
 directory = ".";
 }
 
 // Get all files matching the glob pattern
 string[] matchingFiles = Directory.GetFiles(directory, pattern, SearchOption.TopDirectoryOnly);
 
 if (matchingFiles.Length == 0)
 {
 Console.WriteLine($"No files found matching pattern: {globPattern}");
 return 0;
 }
 
 // Process each matching file
 foreach (string filePath in matchingFiles)
 {
 PrintFileName(filePath);
 }
}
catch (Exception ex)
{
 Console.WriteLine($"Error processing files: {ex.Message}");
 return 1;
}

return 0;

/// <summary>
/// Prints the filename to the console
/// </summary>
/// <param name="filePath">The full path to the file</param>
static void PrintFileName(string filePath)
{
 string fileName = Path.GetFileName(filePath);
 Console.WriteLine($"Processing file: {fileName}");
}

 using System.IO;

// Check if a glob pattern was provided as an argument
if (args.Length == 0)
{
 Console.WriteLine("Usage: SDLexemeDecoder <glob-pattern>");
 Console.WriteLine("Example: SDLexemeDecoder \"*.txt\"");
 return 1;
}

var globPattern = args[0];

try
{
 // Expand ~ to home directory if present using pattern matching
 var expandedPattern = globPattern switch
 {
 ['~', '/', .. var rest] => Path.Combine(Environment.GetFolderPath(Environment.SpecialFolder.UserProfile), rest),
 _ => globPattern
 };
 
 // Separate directory path from pattern
 var directory = Path.GetDirectoryName(expandedPattern) switch
 {
 null or "" => ".",
 var dir => dir
 };
 var pattern = Path.GetFileName(expandedPattern);
 
 // Get all files matching the glob pattern
 var matchingFiles = Directory.GetFiles(directory, pattern, SearchOption.TopDirectoryOnly);
 
 if (matchingFiles.Length == 0)
 {
 Console.WriteLine($"No files found matching pattern: {globPattern}");
 return 0;
 }
 
 // Process each matching file using modern foreach
 foreach (var filePath in matchingFiles)
 {
 ProcessFile(filePath);
 }
}
/// <summary>
/// Prints the filename to the console
/// </summary>
/// <param name="filePath">The full path to the file</param>
static void PrintFileName(string filePath)
{
 Console.WriteLine($"Processing file: {Path.GetFileName(filePath)}");
}
return 0;

/// <summary>
/// Prints the filename to the console
/// </summary>
/// <param name="filePath">The full path to the file</param>
static void ProcessFile(string filePath) =>
 Console.WriteLine($"Processing file: {Path.GetFileName(filePath)}");

 using System.IO;

// Check if a glob pattern was provided as an argument
if (args.Length == 0)
{
 Console.WriteLine("Usage: LexemeExtractor <glob-pattern>");
 Console.WriteLine("Example: LexemeExtractor \"*.txt\"");
 return 1;
}

var globPattern = args[0];

try
{
 // Expand ~ to home directory if present using pattern matching
 var expandedPattern = globPattern switch
 {
 ['~', '/', .. var rest] => Path.Combine(Environment.GetFolderPath(Environment.SpecialFolder.UserProfile), rest),
 _ => globPattern
 };
 
 // Separate directory path from pattern
 var directory = Path.GetDirectoryName(expandedPattern) switch
 {
 null or "" => ".",
 var dir => dir
 };
 var pattern = Path.GetFileName(expandedPattern);
 
 // Get all files matching the glob pattern
 var matchingFiles = Directory.GetFiles(directory, pattern, SearchOption.TopDirectoryOnly);
 
 if (matchingFiles.Length == 0)
 {
 Console.WriteLine($"No files found matching pattern: {globPattern}");
 return 0;
 }
 
 // Process each matching file using modern foreach
 foreach (var filePath in matchingFiles)
 {
 ProcessFile(filePath);
 }
}
catch (Exception ex)
{
 Console.WriteLine($"Error processing files: {ex.Message}");
 return 1;
}

return 0;

static void ProcessFile(string filePath) =>
 Console.WriteLine($"Processing file: {Path.GetFileName(filePath)}");
